newsitem.title: UK: Ladbroke sells property for 37 mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Ladbroke sells property for 37 mln stg.

text.p: Leisure and gaming company Ladbroke Group Plc said it has sold a freehold property in London to Minerva Plc for 37 million stg cash on completion.
The transaction is conditional on Minerva obtaining a full listing on the London Stock Exchange, which is expected to take place next month, Ladbroke said in a statement.
The grade two listed building, at 27-37 Wigmore Street, is a mixed development consisting of office space fully let to a unit of Banque Paribas, retail space and 15 residential flats.
The book value of the property at December 31, 1995 was 41 million stg and the rental income for that year was 2.7 million stg.
Ladbroke said the proceeds of the sale would be used to reduce debt and for investment in the group's core businesses.
